message.content:
cs.DC, cs.AR, cs.SY, cs.CR, cs.NI 

Reasoning: 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper focuses on analyzing the performance of blockchain systems on low-power nodes, which is a key aspect of distributed computing. 
- cs.AR (Hardware Architecture): The paper compares the performance and energy efficiency of different hardware architectures (x86/64 and ARM) in running blockchain systems. 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper discusses the challenges of running full-fledged blockchains on low-power nodes and proposes solutions to achieve reasonable performance while saving energy. 
- cs.CR (Cryptography and Security): Although not the main focus of the paper, blockchain systems are inherently based on cryptography and security, and the paper briefly discusses the security implications of running blockchain on low-power nodes. 
- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): Blockchain systems rely heavily on networking and internet architecture, and the paper discusses the impact of low-bandwidth memory on the performance of blockchain systems.
